DataElement.preferredName: Genomic Medicine Implementation Patient Genetic Testing Uptake Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A medical discipline that uses genomic information about an individual as part of their clinical care (e.g. for diagnostic or therapeutic decision-making) and for the health outcomes and policy implications of that clinical use. (NIH/NHGRI)_The act of carrying into effect._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder._The absorption by a tissue of some substance, food material, mineral, etc., and its permanent or temporary retention.__a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder.
The absorption by a tissue of some substance, food material, mineral, etc., and its permanent or temporary retention.

ReferenceDocuments.name: The reach dimension of Reach
ReferenceDocuments.description: The reach dimension of Reach Effectiveness Adoption Implementation and Maintenance (RE-AIM) includes a four-item checklist used to summarize the characteristics of patients who participate in the uptake of services.

DataElement.origin: RE-AIM:Reach Effectiveness Adoption Implementation and Maintenance (RE-AIM)
